body:
Comment 4: 
I don't think this is getting any easier to understand by making the grammar more
explicit.

For one, the definition of a unicode_char is informal:

unicode_char   = /* an arbitrary Unicode code point except newline */ .

Also, the fact that \' and \" escapes are only valid in char or string literals
respectively is not explicit in the grammar.

As rsc pointed out, this grammar is not primarily designed for machines. Fixing one w/o
the other doesn't make a lot of sense, and fixing all of them will make this more
complicated than it is already for human readers w/o adding much benefit for the
understanding.

Leaving as is.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
